column3: > Concept ACK. I have a branch that does exactly the same thing :)\n\nMy bad, should have communicated before to avoid double work. Feel free to open yours and I'll happily review :)

> My bad, should have communicated before to avoid double work. Feel free to open yours and I'll happily review :)\n\nNot a problem at all! It's good to see that we separately arrived at the same answer :)

Rebased on master (now that #22383 is merged, there is no need to include its commit anymore).
Please don't force push, as this requires re-review. This is a GitHub bug that doesn't affect us.

> Please don't force push, as this requires re-review. This is a GitHub bug that doesn't affect us.\n\nAh, sorry wasn't aware that displaying the first commit is happening due to a GitHub bug (if I understood you correctly). Force-pushed back to how it was before.

Ah, thanks! I was naively only `grep`ing for `Consensus::Params;` to look how other headers would forward-declare this (concluding that they don't and including the header is the preferred way), which is obviously not how it works :grimacing:
ðŸŽ‰
Maybe it's also a good opportunity to address https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22383#discussion_r675069128 here?
I'd say no. Better to keep this as move only and leave lock cleanups for a future PR. That makes this easier to review (and avoids invalidating the three ACKs on the current branch).

The PR was planned to be one of the move-only refactoring kinds that should be trivial to review (strictly speaking, with the follow-up commit changing the RPC help text it's not a pure refactor anymore, but that I'd still consider acceptable). Changing locks is significantly harder to review, so I tend to agree with jnewbery here and leave it as it is by now.
